abstract: San Diego Padres senior vice president Omar Minaya leaves post to become special adviser to Tony Clark, head of Major League Baseball Players Assn.
lead_paragraph: Minaya, the former Mets general manager, will become a special adviser to Tony Clark, the head of the Major League Baseball Players Association.
snippet: Minaya, the former Mets general manager, will become a special adviser to Tony Clark, the head of the Major League Baseball Players Association.

headline.main: Union Hires Omar Minaya as Adviser
